articles.title: Virginia juvenile detention center ending federal contract
articles.description: ALEXANDRIA, Va. (AP) — The Northern Virginia Juvenile Detention Center is ending its contract with the federal government amid local objections to holding non-criminal children in jail-like settings.

articles.author: By MAGGIE MICHAEL and BRIAN ROHAN Associated Press
articles.title: Egypt votes for president, with el-Sissi a sure winner
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — Egyptians began voting Monday in an election that virtually guaranteed another term for President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi, who faced only a token opponent in balloting that resembled the referendums held by autocrats for decades before the Arab Spr…

articles.title: House panel defeats bill to decriminalize simple possession of marijuana

articles.author: BY ROBBY KORTH The Roanoke Times
articles.title: Former Virginia Tech professor is subject of congressional probe
articles.description: A congressional committee is investigating potential misuse of research funds by a former Virginia Tech biological systems engineering professor charged with several fraud crimes last month in federal court.

articles.author: By Robby Korth robby.korth@roanoke.com (540) 381-1679
articles.title: Former Virginia Tech professor subject of congressional probe
articles.description: A congressional committee is investigating potential misuse of research funds by a former Virginia Tech biological systems engineering professor charged with several fraud crimes last month in federal court.

articles.author: BY PATRICK WILSON Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: Delegate-elect Danica Roem: 'I will always be a reporter before I'm a politician'
articles.description: Danica Roem, elected Tuesday as the first transgender lawmaker in Virginia history, is no longer able to keep up with media requests.

articles.author: By MAGGIE MICHAEL and BRIAN ROHAN Associated Press
articles.title: Egypt votes for president, with el-Sissi certain to win
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — Egyptians began voting Monday in an election that President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi is virtually guaranteed to win, one that resembles the referendums held by Arab autocrats in the decades before the 2011 uprisings briefly raised hopes of democrati…

articles.author: By Robby Korth robby.korth@roanoke.com (540) 381-1679
articles.title: Prosecutor: Rogue Radford frat involved in hazing investigation also killed goat
articles.description: RADFORD — The remaining members of a rogue Radford University fraternity had all hazing charges against them dropped Thursday with most pleading guilty to lesser charges.

articles.author: BY PATRICK WILSON Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: After backing marijuana decriminalization, Sen. Norment stops short with bill
articles.description: After saying he was open to decriminalization of marijuana, the state GOP's powerful Senate leader disappointed reform advocates by filing a bill that stops short.

articles.title: Egypt tries to boost voter turnout with incentives, threats
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — One manager threatened employees to get them to vote — and then checked for telltale ink-stained fingers as they clocked in the next day. A regional governor pledged improved water and sanitation service to towns with a…

articles.author: By AMANDA HANCOCK Quad-City Times
articles.title: Davenport barber becomes anchor of community after 50 years
articles.description: DAVENPORT, Iowa (AP) — If no one else is in his barbershop, you'll find Joe McLemore leaning against his chair, lost in a book.

articles.title: AP Was There: The fiery end of the standoff in Waco, Texas
articles.description: WACO, Texas (AP) — Around 6 a.m. on April 19, 1993, FBI agents moved in to end a 51-day standoff with the Branch Davidian religious sect near Waco, Texas, ramming holes in the group's compound with armored vehicles and spraying…
